conclusion: Problem involves two balls P and Q on a smooth horizontal platform with P having mass 4m and no charge, and Q having mass m and negative charge -q, with a magnetic field B on the right side.
Ball P is moving towards Q with initial velocity v₀ = mg/(qB) and they collide elastically.
Need to find velocities of both balls after the collision.
Ball P is moving with velocity v₀ towards Q on a smooth horizontal platform.
Platform is smooth and horizontal, so no frictional forces act on the balls.
Before the collision, both balls are outside the magnetic field, so only gravity affects them.
After the collision, Q will enter the magnetic field and experience a magnetic force due to its velocity and charge.
Collision is elastic, so both momentum and kinetic energy are conserved.
Use conservation of momentum: m_p * v₀ = m_p * v_p + m_q * v_q.
Plug in masses: 4m * v₀ = 4m * v_p + m * v_q.
Simplify momentum equation: 4 v₀ = 4 v_p + v_q.
Use conservation of kinetic energy: (1/2) m_p v₀² = (1/2) m_p v_p² + (1/2) m_q v_q².
Plug in masses for kinetic energy: (1/2)(4m) v₀² = (1/2)(4m) v_p² + (1/2)(m) v_q².
Simplify kinetic energy equation: 2 v₀² = 2 v_p² + (1/2) v_q².
Solve equations simultaneously to find v_p and v_q.
From momentum equation: v_q = 4 v₀ - 4 v_p.
Substitute v_q into kinetic energy equation: 2 v₀² = 2 v_p² + (1/2)(4 v₀ - 4 v_p)².
Expand squared term: (4 v₀ - 4 v_p)² = 16 v₀² - 32 v₀ v_p + 16 v_p².
Substitute expanded term into kinetic energy equation: 2 v₀² = 2 v_p² + 8 v₀² - 16 v₀ v_p + 8 v_p².
